page.title: 06Farming in Dinnington Area.
page.content: Most of the area around Dinnington is {agricultural land.}Some of the farms are owner occupied but others are tenant farmers, Lord Ridley of Blagdon is the principle land owner in the district. The farming is varied, some of the crops being grown in 1985 are barley, peas,winter wheat,hay for the animals winter feed and oil seed rape. Oil seed rape is grown for its vegetable oil, the tiny seeds are crushed and the oil is produced. Some of the land is grazing for cattle being fattened for meat,there are also dairy cows, and sheep.Some farms have pigs, chickens,ducks and horses. Some of the farms have had {Opencast Coal}} workings on their land,this has caused great disruption, it can take up to a generation before the land is fully productive after{Opencast.}The farmers are pleased the Project is finished.
